text: today on applied science i'd like to
show you these silver nano prisms each
of the colorful liquids you can see
there contain silver nano particles and
the shape of those particles are like
little antennae that catch certain
wavelengths of light this is a lot like
the blue morpho butterfly wing which
actually isn't made out of a blue
material it's just shaped in a way that
reflects blue light
but the really crazy bit is how we make
the different colors we start with
basically blob shaped silver nano
particles and shine intense light from
an led on them which causes the blobs to
grow into these very flat triangular
nanoprisms and the color of the light
that we shine on there determines how
big the triangle grows controlling the
edge length which then controls the
color of the solution because we're
changing the size of the antenna pretty
crazy right i actually came across this

the nano prisms
and then we'll kick it up a notch and
i'll show you how i concentrated them in

the electron microscope and then we'll
do some spectroscopy measurements too
